meanings.definition: A plural noun meaning a small fold of tissue that restricts movement in the body.
meanings.sent1: The frena in the mouth help keep the tongue in place.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the frena in the knee can sometimes cause discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The frena decided to have a race to see which one could restrict movement the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the frena, holding back any unnecessary actions.
meanings.sent5: The frena, like tiny gates, controlled the flow of movement in the body.

meanings.definition: A verb meaning to restrict or hinder movement.
meanings.sent1: He used his authority to frena the progress of the project.
meanings.sent2: The heavy traffic can frena the delivery trucks from reaching their destination on time.
meanings.sent3: The strict rules seemed to frena any chance of fun at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure frenaed her from taking risks in her career.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog frenaed visibility on the road, causing delays for drivers.

meanings.definition: A noun meaning a restraint or limitation.
meanings.sent1: The financial frena prevented them from going on vacation.
meanings.sent2: The strict regulations acted as a frena on the company's expansion plans.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected snowstorm was a frena to their outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent4: His lack of experience served as a frena to his promotion at work.
meanings.sent5: The language barrier acted as a frena to effective communication between the two teams.
